channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site
item.description: On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians —...

item.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises
item.description: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-r...

item.title: A bright spot for turtles: Olive ridleys are recovering in India, but still at risk
item.description: India's olive ridley turtle numbers appear to have rebounded after years of patchwork efforts to stem their decline. Can it last?

item.title: Israeli forces kill at least 10 in southern Syria raid, officials and residents say
item.description: Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.

item.title: Death toll from floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra rises to 164
item.description: The death toll from flash floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra island Friday rose to 164 on Friday with 79 people missing, authorities said.

item.title: National Guard member dies after shooting in Washington DC
item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.

item.title: Tracking a major weekend winter storm threatening post-Thanksgiving travel
item.description: A weekend winter storm is threatening travel plans for many looking to get home after Thanksgiving. CBS News Philadelphia meteorologist Andrew Kozak h...

item.title: Eight more arrested over fire in Hong Kong that killed at least 128 people
item.description: Authorities say 89 bodies are unidentified and 79 people remain injured after Wednesday's blaze.

item.title: Trump threatens major immigration overhauls after National Guard shooting
item.description: President Trump said late Thursday that he "will permanently pause migration" from developing nations to the U.S. following the shooting in Washington...

item.title: Trump says he will suspend immigration from all "Third World Countries"
item.description: In a social media post, President Trump wrote that he "will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to ful...

item.title: Thirteen killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria
item.description: The village of Beit Jinn came under attack in what Israel said was an operation against a militant group.

item.title: Zelensky's chief of staff resigns after Ukrainian anti-corruption police raid home
item.description: Yermak, 54, has been Zelensky's closest adviser throughout Russia's full-scale war.

item.title: Suspect faces murder charge in D.C. National Guard shooting
item.description: A National Guard member died in the wake of the shooting near the White House, President Trump said.

item.title: Trump vows to ‘permanently pause’ migration from poor nations in anti-immigrant social media screed
Lightning detected on Mars for the first time, scientists say
item.description: Researchers heard electric crackles on 28 hours of recordings made over two Martian years.

item.title: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom dies after D.C. attack, officials say
item.description: Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom, one of the victims of Wednesday's ambush-style attack in Washington, D.C., died Thursday night. A coast-to-coast investigat...

item.title: Refugee groups worry about backlash after shooting of National Guard soldiers in DC
2 National Guard members shot in an ambush attack just blocks from the White House
item.description: Two West Virginia National Guard members who deployed to the U.S. capital have been shot blocks from the White House in a brazen act of violence that ...
